page.title: 07St.Mary's Church/Tithe Barn
page.content: In Ditchingham there is a{tithe barn} that was built about 5 to 6 hundred years ago.The rector had it because long ago they did'nt pay him in money they paid a tithe of cattle,horses and corn.We went upstairs and saw criss-crossed thatch and beams which had Roman numbers carved on them.The barn is partly made of brick but is mostly of timber. {St.Mary's Church}-a church has stood on this site since 1086.The present tower,built in 1479,is about 500 years old.Outside the church are some footstones from graves.Inside there is a bronze war memorial of a 1st world war soldier.The spiral staircase has 102 stairs and a door leading to the clockroom.Two of the church bells are 700 years old.
